description.narrative: The expected outcome is "Improved international and national non-governmental organisation (NGO) engagement in South Sudan in the delivery of humanitarian and development assistance". The expected impact is "Effective and principled delivery of humanitarian and development assistance by NGOs South Sudan".

Insatsen utgör ett stöd till South Sudan NGO Forum för perioden 1 december 2017-31 augusti 2020. NGO Forum utgör en medlemsbaserad plattform med drygt 300 internationella och nationella icke-statliga organisationer i Sydsudan. NGO Forums mål är att bidra till ett mer effektivt och samordnat humanitärt och långsiktigt utvecklingsstöd i Sydsudan. För att uppnå detta stödjer NGO Forums sekretariat samordning, kommunikation, påverksansarbete, kapacitetsutveckling, samt säkerhetssamarbete bland det stora antal NGO:er som levererar service och bidrar till fredsbyggande och utveckling i landet. Det är Sidas bedömning att NGO Forums verksamhet, som utformats av medlemmarna under många års samarbete, är relevant, effektiv och motsvarar behoven i en föränderlig och synnerligen utmanande kontext. Det är även Sidas bedömning att NGO Forums sekretariat har erfoderlig kapacitet att fortsätta genomföra dess aktiviteter. samt att Concern Worldwide (som värdorganisation/fondadministratör för sekreteriatet) utgör en tillförlitlig samarbetspartner.

The intervention provides support for the South Sudan NGO Forum for the period 1 December 2017 to 31 August 2020. The NGO Forum is a member-based platform with more than 300 international and national NGO members in South Sudan. The NGO Forum's goal is to contribute to a more efficient and coordinated humanitarian and long-term development support in South Sudan. To achieve this, the NGO Forum Secretariat supoprts coordination, communication, advocacy, capacity development and security cooperation among the large number of NGOs delivering services and contributing to peace building and development in the country. Sida's assessment is that NGO Forum's activities, designed by the members during many years of cooperation, are relevant, effective and meet the needs of a changing and extremely challenging context. It is also Sida's assessment that the NGO Forum Secretariat has adequate capacity to carry out its activities and that the Concern Worldwide (as a host organisation/fund administrator of the secretariat) is a reliable partner.

title.narrative: Agreement between Sida and Concern Worldwide, South Sudan NGO Forum 2017-2020
Decision on contribution South Sudan NGO Forum 2017-2020

description.narrative: The activities of the NGO Forum are grouped in four clusters. Examples of results under each cluster are: Information Sharing and Coordination: Support to members in their information sharing and coordination role through sharing of 54 Country/National Director weekly updates, 10 circulars and 27 legislation documents via the NGO forum communication portal during the period September 2019 - February 2020. During the same period NGO Forum's online web resources recorded a total of 6,8 million unique page views serving over 117,000 users, ranking the website among the most visited sites in South Sudan. Safety, Security and Crisis Management: From September 2019 to February 2020, the NGO Forum Security Team coordinated the relocation of 198 NGO workers through the Saving Lives Together (SLT) framework with the support of UNHAS,WFP, UNDSS and OCHA. Under SLT there were 392 information exchanges and meetings held between NGO Forum and UNDSS/UNMISS. The Security Team also provided security incident datatsets and area profiles on request. Advocacy, Policy and External Engagement: NGO Forum has broadened its relationships and engagement with ministries and authorities of all parties to the conflict, in order to support Forum members to access beneficiaries without hindrance, or resolve impediments when they arise (for example relating to tax issues). This has reduced costs to NGOs and the wider humanitarian community in operations, financial, human resource and time terms and has helped bring about increased clarity and understanding in the operating environment. NGO's Networking and Capacity Development: From September 2019 to February 2020, NGO Forum through its Focal Point member CIPAD provided gender mainstreaming, Prevention of Sexual Exploitation and Abuse (PSEA) and trauma healing strategies training to 60 NGOs in Juba. Through this initiative the NGO Forum also developed a model PSEA policy and code of conduct that the NGO Forum has asked national NGOs to adopt and adapt for use and opeartionalise.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
